decision_conditions: <p><font face="Arial"><span style="font-size: 14.6667px; white-space: pre-wrap;">The proposed ground floor wrap around rear extension and associated roof terrace, by reason of its excessive width, design, scale and siting would result in an obtrusive and incompatible form of development which would fail to respect the character and appearance of the subject property and the terrace of which it forms part and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Brownswood Conservation Area. As such the proposed development is contrary to policies D3 (Optimising Site Capacity through the Design-led Approach) and HC1 (Heritage Conservation and Growth) of the London Plan 2021, LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character), LP3 (Designated Heritage Assets) and LP17 (Housing Design) of the Hackney Local Plan 2033, and the guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009.</span></font><br></p>

<p>The proposed development, in the absence of a legal agreement to contribute towards the Carbon Offset Fund,&nbsp; would fail to meet the London Objective of being a zero-carbon city by 2050, contrary to policies SI 2 (Minimising greenhouse gas emissions) of the London Plan (2021), policy&nbsp; LP55 (Mitigating Climate Change) of Hackney’s Local Plan 2033 (2020) and Hackney's S106 Planning Contributions SPD (2020).<br></p>

<p>The proposed development, in the absence of a legal agreement to secure car-free housing, would be likely to promote the use of non-sustainable modes of transport and contribute to air pollution and congestion in the surrounding area, contrary to policies T6 (Car Parking) of the London Plan (2021), policy LP45 (Parking and Car Free Development) of Hackney’s Local Plan 2033 (2020) and Hackney's S106 Planning Contributions SPD (2020).<br></p>

<p>The proposed development, in the absence of a legal agreement to secure a contribution towards affordable housing fails to deliver the maximum reasonable amount of affordable housing and is therefore contrary to Policy H4 (Delivering affordable housing) of the London Plan (2021) and Policy LP13 (Affordable housing) of Hackney’s Local Plan 2033 (2020) and Hackney's S106 Planning Contributions SPD (2020).<br></p>

<p>The proposed replacement of rear window with door and Juliet balcony by virtue of its design, siting and scale would result in an inappropriate addition to the rear elevation at an elevated position which would harm the character and appearance of the host building, surrounding terrace and Conservation Area&nbsp;<span style="font-family: Arial; font-size: 14.6667px; white-space: pre-wrap;">contrary to policies D3 (Optimising Site Capacity through the Design-led Approach) and HC1 (Heritage Conservation and Growth) of the London Plan 2021, LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character), LP3 (Designated Heritage Assets) and LP17 (Housing Design) of the Hackney Local Plan 2033, and the guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009.</span></p>

<p>The proposed development by virtue of not providing adequate cycle storage fails to promote sustainable transport within the Borough contrary to LP42 of the Hackney Local Plan(2020) and Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).<br></p>

<p>The proposed flats 2 and 3 would result in substandard accommodation due to insufficient floorspace and poor privacy contrary to policy LP17&nbsp; of the Hackney Local Plan 2033 (2020) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021)</p>

<p>Insufficient information has been submitted with regard to the impact of the air source heat pump on noise in the surrounding area contrary to Policy LP2 of the Hackney Local Plan (2020).</p><p><br></p>

<p><font face="Arial"><span style="font-size: 14.6667px; white-space: pre-wrap;">The proposed front</span>&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 14.6667px; white-space: pre-wrap;">light well and set of double doors at basement level, by reason of design, siting and scale would result in an obtrusive and incompatible form of development which would fail to respect the character and appearance of the subject property and the terrace of which it forms part and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Brownswood Conservation Area. As such the proposed development is contrary to policies D3 (Optimising Site Capacity through the Design-led Approach) and HC1 (Heritage Conservation and Growth) of the London Plan 2021, LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character), LP3 (Designated Heritage Assets) and LP17 (Housing Design) of the Hackney Local Plan 2033, and the guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009.</span></font><br></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-7d3f2bf1-7fff-7726-2038-ef417b73000b"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.295;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The proposed outrigger extension and associated roof terrace, including glazed balustrades, by reason of its excessive height, detailed design, siting and scale would result in an obtrusive and incompatible form of development which would fail to respect the character and appearance of the subject property and the terrace of which it forms part and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Brownswood Conservation Area. As such the proposed development is contrary to policies D3 (Optimising Site Capacity through the Design-led Approach) and HC1 (Heritage Conservation and Growth) of the London Plan 2021, LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character), LP3 (Designated Heritage Assets) and LP17 (Housing Design) of the Hackney Local Plan 2033, and the guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009.</span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-0b991e53-7fff-742c-cf24-d94e807f2471"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;">The proposed roof extension and rooflights, by reason of  excessive bulk, scale, massing, detailed design, position and location would result in an obtrusive and incompatible form of development which would fail to respect the character and appearance of the subject property, terrace of which it forms part and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Brownswood Conservation Area. As such the proposed development is contrary to policies D3 (Optimising Site Capacity through the Design-led Approach) and HC1 (Heritage Conservation and Growth) of the London Plan 2021, LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character), LP3 (Designated Heritage Assets) and LP17 (Housing Design) of the Hackney Local Plan 2033, and the guidance contained within Hackney Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD 2009.</span></span><br></p>

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: A4D Storage and distribution to residential

description: Excavation and extension of a basement including front and rear light wells; single storey rear ground floor extension; rear roof extension; alterations to outrigger; creation of roof terraces; to allow for the conversion of a single dwelling into 4 x residential units and associated cycle and waste storage.
